Description:
The Choice Is Yours !!
Such a rare opportunity to purchase this B/V home set on 2735 sq.m allotment. Zoned residential with two street access, ideal for subdivision (STCA). The spacious home offers 3 bedrooms (all with BIR'S).Main with ensuite plus a private courtyard. Family bathroom and ensuite both require renovation. Huge lounge with timber cathedral ceilings and cosy solid fuel heater. Original country style kitchen with plenty of space for meals area. 2nd toilet off laundry.
Ducted evaporative cooling. Central atrium which could quite easily be converted to a 4th bedroom/study if required. Double carport with roller door, undercover outdoor entertaining, shed (no power or concrete), beautiful lily pond with a bridge. Good fencing. Close to Huntly shops, school and much more. Perfect for a tradie looking for a project or for somebody looking for lots of space.
Insights: 696 Midland Highway, Huntly VIC 3551 was last sold in 2002 and 24 other 3 bedroom house in Huntly have recently been sold.

Description:
Sound Investment With Excellent Rental Return.
If you are looking for a sound investment with an excellent rental return, you need to look no further than this well-presented brick veneer unit in the heart of Kennington. With an estimated weekly return of $230 per week, the body corporate covering the maintenance of the front of the property and building insurance for an investor everything is taken care of.
This one bedroom unit situated in a great residential area of Bendigo, will be a sound addition to any property portfolio close to Bendigo CBD, Kennington Village, La Trobe University, schools and public transport at your doorstep.
The unit comprises lounge with split-system heating and cooling, and functional kitchen with gas cooking, electric oven, dishwasher and ample storage. Large main bedroom with wall-to-wall built-in robes, plus large bathroom, laundry, 2kw solar system and single carport/parking with side access to a private a secure yard.
There is always high demand for this type of property with excellent return or for the owner-occupier looking to secure property in popular Kennington.
Insights: 4/42 Mafeking Street South, Kennington VIC 3550 was last sold in 2020.

Description:
LIFESTYLE PROPERTY/HOBBY FARM WITH THE WHOLE PACKAGE.
This beautiful BV home built by a local Master builder, set on almost 16 acres (approx.. 6.13 Ha) and located in the picturesque Lockwood area, welcomes you to sit back, relax and enjoy a lifestyle like no other.
The elevated residence offers spacious family living starting with versatile formal lounge room and a central living room, both serviced by a large, double-fronted wood heater that is situated in the middle of these 2 rooms creating double the ambience. Adjoining this is a home office with convenient external access and a huge family/rumpus room where a wall of North-facing windows beam light into every corner.
Sleeping accommodation is all large in size, consisting of a main bedroom with walk in robe, and stunning, newly renovated, large ensuite, equipped with double basins, full bath, toilet and shower. 3 more good sized bedrooms, all with robes and ceiling fans, share the updated family bathroom.
The large family sized kitchen features electric cooking appliances, dishwasher, walk in pantry and more storage than most homes, with a family sized dining area and storage-rich, well-equipped laundry alongside.
An expansive alfresco area runs the length of the house and adjoins the fenced 10m x 4m inground pool, making an ideal setting for large scale entertaining for all age groups. There is more though, where sweeping lawns flow down to a full sized tennis court, which is fully fenced with brand new LED flood-lit lighting. The views from this area are just breath taking with rolling hills behind the tennis court to add to the postcard look. The undulating property includes: excellent rainwater storage (approx.. 75,000 litres), three dams (with the main one full), plus a bore. The property is divided into 5 paddocks, with new fencing, and bordered by a pretty seasonal creek with fertile flats on one side and State Forest at the rear. Shedding includes: a 3 bay carport, 3 car garage & workshop with concrete floor and power, PLUS extra shedding with power, concrete floor and water.
Located approx.. 6 kms from all Kangaroo Flat facilities, this one ticks all the boxes. It is a tranquil escape where adults can enjoy life in the slow lane, and the kids can swim, play tennis or basketball, have some pets, grow some veggies, have some chooks, ride a horse or a motorbike, have a picnic down on the creek, or just beat about the bush out the back.
Sometimes words are not enough, so bring the family out to see for themselves. Once seen this one will be hard to forget. This property has created so many wonderful memories and events for the current Vendors, and they know the next owners will love and enjoy the property just as they have.
Inspection a must to appreciate this lifestyle property.
Insights: 661 Lockwood Road, Lockwood VIC 3551 was last sold in 2000 and 1 other 4 bedroom house in Lockwood have recently been sold.

Description:
Affordable, entry-level 2 bedroom unit
Fantastic opportunity to get a foothold in the property market with this well priced and affordable 2 bedroom unit.
Loaded with features such as brand new carpet throughout, plus refrigerated A/C and gas wall furnace for year round comfort. Compact kitchen, solar panels to help keep costs down and a tidy level private rear yard. Rental appraisal $230 -$240 per week so you can expect a good rental return from the property.
All this and located within walking distance to public transport and other necessary facilities. It's neat, clean and well presented.

Description:
ESCAPE INTO YOUR OWN PRIVATE SANCTUARY!
This is one of the finest Murray Wearne built masterpieces. Designed & constructed to showcase impressive craftsmanship - it is a modern delight!
- Nestled away at the end of Merlot Close, this is a vibrant family friendly suburb
- Upon entrance you will be captivated. Exposed aggregate driveway, large triple garage and a delightful facade
- Featuring a flowing floor plan with high ceilings, an abundance of natural light and features striking polished concrete flooring
- Four large bedrooms, two bathrooms, plus separate powder room, study and formal lounge
- Complete with attractive entertaining areas, also offering excellent storage and parking
- A stunning central open plan kitchen featuring a huge walk in butler's pantry, stone bench-top, induction cook-top & quality stainless-steel appliances
- Spacious meals and family zone, with an additional separate lounge. Offering flexibility & space for the entire family
- Unique & relaxed outside living spaces with timber alfresco decking, the perfect nook to escape too
- Sliding door access from the open plan zone to the undercover alfresco, complete with outdoor kitchen / BBQ overlooking the lush lawn
- Extras include ducted gas heating, evaporative cooling, separate study and an ever so handy storage shed at the rear
- Triple car garage with roller door access through to the landscaped yard
Why would you build when you can take the stress out of the process & move straight into the finished designer product. This home will capture your heart!
Directions: Turn off the Calder Highway into Lower Beckham's Road, continue all the way to the end & enter Meadows Gate Estate, turn left into Cabernet Drive, which runs into Merlot Close.

Description:
Lifestyle & Luxury In Aspirational Maiden Gully
If you don't want to compromise on style, space or quality, then 25 Eden Way is for you. With a fantastic layout, and premium finishes throughout this property will impress you from the moment you step through the door. Offering two great sized separate living zones, and 3 generous bedrooms along with a huge open plan living, dining and meals area.
Master bedroom boasts walk in robe while the ensuite features his and hers basins in the large vanity.
Bedrooms 2 and 3 both have built in robes and are serviced by the ducted heating and cooling which runs throughout.
But there are two jewels that really shine in this stunning home, the large stone top island bench in the kitchen which boasts seating for breakfast or the currently popular "work-from-home" desk. The kitchen offer gas cooktop, ample storage and walk-in pantry.
The second jewel is huge alfresco area which offers exposed aggregate underfoot, down lights and provisions for an outdoor tv set up.
To top this of the home has double lock up garage as well as side access, and makes clever use of the generous block allowing for a great size yard to kids or back yard cricket enthusiasts.
Finally, if the offer is not enough, Eden Way is just a 10 minute walk from the stunning, award winning Balgownie Estate Winery.
Further, Maiden Gully IGA is 3 minutes by car, as is Maiden Gully Primary while Marist College is 4 minutes away.
This is a complete package and will not last. Call Sacha now!

Description:
OVER SIX ACRES JUST DOWN THE ROAD FROM THE LODDON RIVER
Located in the heart of the pretty Loddon Shire, with Kooyoora State Park, Waanyarra Nature Conservation Reserve, Bridgewater on Loddon and Lake Laanecoorie all just minutes away, is this homestead on over six acres and bordered by established trees. Just half an hour from all the city amenities of Bendigo, the property offers a lush, private, rural farmlet that is still close to everything.
A wide verandah runs across both the front and the rear of the house, providing the perfect place to sit with a cuppa in the sunshine regardless of the time of day. The front door opens into a living room, with a fireplace providing added warmth and atmosphere in the winter. The living space leads into a kitchen and dining room and the kitchen enjoys vintage cabinetry.
A hallway from the kitchen and lounge take you to the three bedrooms, all with built-in robes, along with a large laundry; a family bathroom; and a separate toilet.
Outdoors, a single carport and alfresco space overlook a lawn area and the land including the dam beyond. A variety of outbuildings provide storage for wood and tools. The land is fully fenced and split into four fenced paddocks.
Additional features include:
- Split system heating and cooling
- Solid fuel heating
- Ceiling fans throughout
- Stove with separate grill and four-burner gas cooktop
- Various outbuildings
- Four fenced paddocks
- Dam
- 2mg water entitlement from Loddon River
- Water tanks
This property is absolutely ideal for a buyer who is seeking a pocket of land for horses, sheep or planting, but still wants easy access to city amenities along with fishing, cycling, hiking and boating. With minor cosmetic changes ensuring this would make a charming country home, the land and water provide all you need to enjoy a simple and relaxed rural lifestyle. Currently leased to great tenants... vacant possession is available.

Description:
2 ACRES (8161sqm) ONLY MINUTES TO BENDIGO CBD
Build your dream home and enjoy the tranquility, peace and quiet of this tucked away location on a lightly treed and elevated 2 acre (0.82ha) allotment just off Holdsworth Road. A 3 lot subdivision had previously been approved, so the potential is also there to subdivide into 2 or 3 lots (STCA).
With option to access from Latham Street or Degille Street, you are surrounded by nature reserves and walking tracks, while being located a quick drive to Bendigo Health, Lake Weeroona and the CBD in one direction, or Eaglehawk in the other direction. North Bendigo Preschool, White Hills Primary, Saint Peters Primary and Weeroona College are all conveniently nearby. All services are also available or nearby.
It is certainly rare to find a piece of land this size so close to so many amenities!
Contact Shelby Healey on 0428 488 685 for further information.
Insights: 9 Latham Street, North Bendigo VIC 3550 was last sold in 2020.

Description:
GLENIRA CHARMING COTTAGE NEAR CITY CENTRE
This pretty heritage cottage is located just five minutes walk to Bendigos train station, providing easy access to the very heart of the city and all its amenities. Sitting on the edge of the industrial hub of Golden Square and offering varied zoning, the property is positioned in a locale ensuring that it may be easily utilised for a variety of purposes be it business-based or simply convenient city living.
The refurbished weatherboard cottage offers many heritage features such as original timber flooring, sash windows and high ceilings and the exterior features a charming bullnose verandah with decorative iron lacework behind a lawn area and rose bushes. Indoors, a central hallway leads on either side to spacious bedrooms, one with an open fireplace and timber mantle.
At the end of the hallway is a good-sized lounge room with a gas log fire inserted in the original fireplace, perfect for cosy winter evenings. A door leads from this room to the rear garden. Off the lounge is a spacious room that could serve as a third bedroom, or a formal dining space. Beyond the lounge is a contemporary kitchen with ample storage and a servery window overlooking the alfresco outdoors. Off the kitchen is a small hallway leading down to a separate toilet; a large laundry and utility room; and a family bathroom.
Outdoors, a deck wraps around the rear and side of the home, with a verandah off the back of the house keeping much of this outdoor living space undercover. This fantastic entertaining area overlooks the private rear yard, which is mainly set to lawn and includes a garden shed. Double gates at the side off the house allow easy vehicle access to the back garden.
Additional features include:
Split system heating and cooling in lounge
Gas log fire
Open fireplace
Contemporary kitchen with dishwasher, oven and four-burner gas cooktop
Gas hot water
Garden shed
Secure vehicle access to rear yard
Residential and Business 3 zoning
Absolutely ideal for a buyer seeking a character home in a central locale, this neat and tidy property is also perfect for an investor looking for an easy-care, long- or short-term rental, or someone wanting to run a business from a traditional Victorian cottage near all amenities.

Address: Lot 22/ Golden Grove - Stage 1 Jackass Flat VIC 3556
Description:
A Modern Estate in a Quiet Hidden Domain
Golden Grove land subdivision is a brand new and fresh lifestyle choice the whole family will love.
With the opportunity to walk to playgrounds, Golf Courses and also the new childcare facility that has recently been completed, what more could you ask for.
Whether you choose to ride your bike or walk with the children to the lovely creek side playground, quality family time will be recovered when you get home from work whilst still being only a 9 minute drive from the Bendigo CBD.
There are several options for shopping with Epsom, Bendigo and Eaglehawk all being only minutes away.
Schooling is available and easily accessed for all ages from prep to year 12.
Allotments are all fully serviced with quality homes about to commence construction.
In a great location; with parkland, walking trails, a lake, playground and much more!
Plenty of amenities nearby being, Early Learning Centre (650m) bus stop (600m), Epsom Primary School (3.8km), Epsom Shopping Village (5km)
Medical facilities will give peace of mind in addition to only being several minutes' drive to Bendigo's and one of Victoria's newest hospital.

Description:
'Arms Cottage'
Meticulously renovated and restored to infuse its original beauty with timeless class. Wide Victorian hallway with radiant chandeliers, three large bedrooms all with BIR'S and polished floorboards, main with working fireplace. Formal lounge with open fire place and exquisite mantle and PFB's. Sparkling fully equipped kitchen, Bosch D/W and gas cooking. Stunning 4-piece bathroom including free standing bath. The second living/ dining room leads out to brick paved outdoor space plus a great sized landscaped yard with large garden shed and raised vegetable and herb beds. The side drive allows enough space for caravan or extra car spaces. Extras include ducted gas heating, evap. cooling, restumped, rewired and re insulated.
The home (Arms Cottage) was run as a successful Airbnb for approx. 18 months prior to final renovations being completed.
The property has two titles and is set on a total of 817 sq. By realigning the boundary (STCA), the home would be on 517 sq.m and the vacant block 300 sq. m. The current owners have plans available (not approved) for a home to compliment the surrounding heritage neighborhood. Other ideas would be maybe a shed, pool or granny flat (STCA).
A little bit of history: Originally 2 side by side Victorian Terraces built in 1878. In 1899 a fire broke out in the left side Terrace and even though the neighbors came with buckets and tried to put it out the home was destroyed. In 1920 the terrace was replaced with a Cal Bungalow. This is the reason why the windows at the front of the house are not identical.
Insights: 25 Arms Street, Long Gully VIC 3550 was last sold in 2020 and 42 other 3 bedroom house in Long Gully have recently been sold.

Description:
Classic Family Living Close to Hospital
This neatly presented weatherboard home has undergone a beautiful renovation whilst keeping the character of a typical California bungalow.
Step inside from the decked veranda to hardwood floors throughout. Master bedroom with leadlight bay window with built-in storage, built-in robes, and ceiling fan whilst the other two bedrooms also with built-in robes and ceiling fans. The family bathroom includes a spa bath, vanity, and separate shower.
The updated kitchen has an abundance of bench and cupboard space, 900mm 5 burner gas hotplates, electric oven, dishwasher, and walk-in pantry.
The home opens up to a large north-facing lounge and dining area with plenty of built-in cabinetry and overlooks the decked rear entertaining area.
Ducted gas heating and ducted evaporative cooling services the home. Laundry has been beautifully updated with separate WC.
Watch the kids play in their elevated cubby house in the rear yard, approx. 530m2 which also has a large 13,600-litre rainwater tank connected to the home, servicing the lawns and gardens.
The 3m x 9m shed is the tradesmans dream with built-in workbenches and roller door access to the rear of the block.
Located within walking distance Bendigo Hospital, Lake Weeroona, QEO & Bendigo CBD, or kick the footy on the North Bendigo Recreative Reserve a mere 100m away, this home has all the modern conveniences expected in a family home.
Inspections by private appointment only.

Description:
Central Charming California Bungalow
Ready to rent, renovate or simply move in. This well located family home on over 840m2 in Quarry Hill offers schools, parks, playgrounds, pubs, marketplace, train station and CBD all within easy walking distance.
Three good size bedrooms plus study will comfortably sleep family and guests. The front facing bedrooms sharing the classic charm of timber-framed sash windows and plantation shutters.The master bedroom boasts built-in robe and a full ensuite with double shower and leadlight window.
Follow the high ceilings and original timber floors to a country style kitchen boasting island bench and all modern amenities plus a functioning potbelly stove for a retro stew or some extra heat.The open plan dining room opens onto a charming lounge, with internal leadlight window, timber mantel and decorative brick fireplace.Family bathroom features a charming clawfoot bath and separate shower with north light bouncing in over the timber vanity.
With more house than meets the eye, find an additional living room and an enormous undercover area for year-round entertaining and comfort (or to stow the caravan or boat).
Gas ducted heating throughout the home keep you warm in winter and evaporative cooling in front bedrooms and living areas.
The spacious backyard shares a substantial lawn for backyard cricket and kick to kick, among mature trees and emerging natives. Tucked behind a handy workshed is the Hills hoist and herb garden.
Current owners have refreshed the roof with a modern colour, ready for a lucky new owner to put their stamp on the exterior or leave as is.
Not to be missed!

Description:
BEAUTIFUL BUSHLAND RETREAT
Escape to a beautiful bushland retreat with this stone and brick home. Set amongst six acres (approx.) of native bushland, its hard to believe that all the amenities of Strathfieldsaye schools, shops, medical practitioners, cafes and more are just minutes away and the centre of Bendigo is less than 15 minutes drive.
Set well back from the lane, down a long sweeping driveway, the house sits beautifully amongst the landscape. Stone garden beds flank the entry and the front door opens into a formal entry and onto a large, light-filled lounge. Stairs off the lounge lead up to three bedrooms, all with split system heating and cooling and built-in robes, along with a recently refurbished family bathroom. The master bedroom is located downstairs, next to the lounge, and features a built-in robe and sliding door to the garden outside. Next door is a recently refurbished bathroom, serving as an ensuite.
The hallway from the entry leads past a laundry, and down to a spectacular open plan kitchen, living and dining room. This space offers high cathedral ceilings and sliding doors that open out to the rear yard looking out to a stunning vista across the bushland. A wood burning heater ensures the space is appreciated year-round, and the kitchen includes ample storage.
A large alfresco deck outdoors also features a high cathedral ceiling ensuring the view is uninterrupted, both indoors and out. The deck overlooks a large inground swimming pool and lawn area that is fully fenced. Beyond the pool yard are raised garden beds, chook pen, fenced dog yard off the side of the house and a shed. At the front of the home is a large dam.
Additional features include:
Split system heating and cooling throughout
Ceiling fans throughout
Solid fuel heating in main living area
Timber-framed sash windows and sliding doors
Modern kitchen appliances including dishwasher, oven and four-burner gas cooktop
3 x tanks (2 x 50,000l and 1 x 16,000l)
Septic water tank
Inground swimming (easy-care salt chlorinated with solar heating and solar blanket)
Shed
Dam
This beautiful and unique property is absolutely ideal for a buyer looking for a relaxed, country home that is still within easy reach of all amenities. With its tranquil outlook and peaceful surrounds, this stunning home is move-in ready and provides rural living less than 15 minutes to the centre of the city.

Description:
More than meets the eye
If you're looking for a unique, low maintenance home or investment, look no further than 9A Niemann Street, right in central Bendigo!
Located in a small cul-de-sac, on a compact 262m2 (approx.) block on its own title and set on the edges of the hospital precinct sits 23 squares of living over 2 storeys that is 9A Niemann Street, Bendigo. An independently built, great find for the downsizers, first home buyers, entertainers and investors alike.
Though this property may seem small upon first glance, this is a classic case of looks can be deceiving'.
Entering the property at the naturally lit top floor, you are met with an inviting hallway, leading directly into the vast open kitchen/living/dining space. The kitchen is a great spot for the home cook or entertainer. It comprises of stone bench top, modern European appliances, dishwasher and ample storage spaces, as well as a low maintenance, mod wood decking space that opens up the entire first floor to the outside and views to the Bendigo CBD.
To the right you will find the master bedroom. A very well sized room with reverse cycle air conditioning, that lends itself to more gorgeous natural lighting and an en-suite with spa bath and huge shower.
To view the rest of the home, you must head downstairs. At the bottom of the stairs you come straight into the second living room. From here, through to the hallway, you will find the remaining 2 well sized bedrooms. All naturally cool and ceiling fans in each.
Built in 2011, this property is incredibly low maintenance with native gardens and is brick veneer, but also North facing with clerestory windows, and electric solar power and hot water system, and ground floor water tasks all adding to the energy efficiency rating of 6 Stars. With gas heating and air conditioning throughout you will stay comfortable all year round.
(ENOE)

Description:
A First Homebuyer's Opportunity!
Situated on a good sized allotment, this charming home includes 2 bedrooms, a formal lounge, formal dining, large entrance hall and other period details. Close to the CBD and all that Bendigo has to offer this home is priced right at the first home buyer or investor. Externally the property includes a lock-up garage and established garden. The opportunities for this property are endless - renovate, change the floorplan to include a third bedroom or add to your investment portfolio.

Description:
FAMILY LIVING
Located in a well regarded area of popular Maiden Gully and nearby to Maiden Gully Shops, Bakery & Primary School is this superb family home with features aplenty. Positioned on a commanding 1000m2 allotment and with elevated views to the west the home itself features 4 generous bedrooms plus study including master with Walk in Robe and En-suite. The remaining 3 bedrooms have built in robes and adjoin a rumpus room / kids play area - one of the 3 internal living areas to this home. There is a fully appointed central kitchen with stainless steel appliances and ample bench space plus cupboard storage with the addition of a coffee station in the dining area. Outside features a spacious covered entertaining area which overlooks the rear yard - ideal for large gatherings of family and friends! There is side vehicle access to the yard which includes a 9m x 6m shed with high clearance roller door. A separate stoned fire-pit area provides another casual entertaining space on those brisk evenings!
Take a short stroll to the community playground, Maiden Gully Sports Reserve or Jenny's Early Learning Centre only just down the road. This community has a lot to offer!

Description:
Exceptional family home on a fabulous 718m2 block
- Immaculate three bedroom family home beautifully presented
- A lovely 718m2 block with carport and workshop (5m x 10m)
- Master bedroom has direct access to the two-way bathroom
- Spacious kitchen with pantry adjoining a large separate lounge
- Ducted evaporative cooling, gas heating and solar power
- Undercover entertainment area, water tanks and fully landscaped yard
- Shutters on front windows, nicely painted throughout and extremely well maintained
- Double carport and garage/workshop. Very nice established garden
- Exceptionally good location close to all amenities and a few minutes drive to the new Hospital and Lake Weeroona
This beautifully presented home has been fastidiously maintained and presents exceptionally well. Simply move in, absolutely nothing to spend! A really nice yard for the family or grandchildren with a low maintenance garden. Being one of the best locations in Bendigo for families this home is ideal for the first home buyer or family.
